intro: Heliotropium adenense, commonly known as the "false heliotrope," is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink to purple in color, blooming throughout the growing season. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Heliotropium adenense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
